abstract: Christopher Bailey is resigning as Burberry chief exec, but will stay on in new dual role of president and chief creative officer; changes follow profit decline and executive departures, and ends company's experiment of allowing one person to be both chief exec and creative director; Celine executive Marco Gobbetti will become luxury house's new chief.

byline.contributor: Vanessa Friedman contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Christopher Bailey’s resignation as chief executive — though he will stay on as president and chief creative officer — comes after a slowdown in sales and a fall in profit.

headline.main: Burberry C.E.O. to Step Down, Ending Dual-Role Experiment at Helm
headline.print_headline: Burberry Chief to Resign, Ending Dual-Role Trial
